author: Bob Tita
title: Why One Slice of the U.S. Steel Industry Welcomes Trump’s Tariff Exemptions
text:
The Trump administration’s decision to temporarily exempt several countries from new tariffs provides relief to some of the largest U.S. customers of imported steel: processors of semifinished steel.
The U.S. imported nearly 8 million metric tons of such steel last year, more than a fifth of all steel imports. Most arrived as the mattress-sized slabs that are reheated and rolled into sheet steel for products including pipe and automotive components.

Seib examined whether these moves could ignite a trade war with South Korea and China. Photo: AP (Originally Published January 24, 2018)
